dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, have you seen this wild story about Walmart suing Tesla?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, have you seen this wild story about Walmart suing Tesla?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elon Musk Walmart claims that Tesla installed faulty solar panels that eventually spontaneously combusted and caught fire at seven Walmart stores around the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, yes! I literally just read about it. It's pretty gnarly, right? About their solar panels.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, yes! I literally just read about it. It's pretty gnarly, right? About their solar panels.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Gnarly is an understatement! [chuckles] Like, they're claiming faulty panels that actually, *spontaneously combusted* and caught fire? At seven different stores?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Gnarly is an understatement! Like, they're claiming faulty panels that actually, spontaneously combusted and caught fire? At seven different stores?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elon Musk Walmart claims that Tesla installed faulty solar panels that eventually spontaneously combusted and caught fire at seven Walmart stores around the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. Seven stores, across the country. And, uh, Walmart is basically saying that Tesla's inspectors just, like, totally missed defects that were super visible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. Seven stores, across the country. And, uh, Walmart is basically saying that Tesla's inspectors just, like, totally missed defects that were super visible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The lawsuit alleges that Tesla inspectors didnt notice defects that were visible to the naked eye...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Visible to the naked eye, even? [overlaps] That's what I heard.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Visible to the naked eye, even? That's what I heard.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. And they apparently used cable connectors that weren't even compatible with each other, and just, like, left loose, hanging wires everywhere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh. And they apparently used cable connectors that weren't even compatible with each other, and just, like, left loose, hanging wires everywhere.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...used cable connectors that werent compatible with one another and failed to see that loose and hanging wires were present at multiple sites.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, like, what's Walmart's theory on *why* this happened? I mean, Tesla, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, like, what's Walmart's theory on why this happened? I mean, Tesla, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, Walmart believes it was all, um, due to rushed installations. They're alleging Tesla's solar division had this "ill-considered business model" that just pushed them to install systems haphazardly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, Walmart believes it was all, um, due to rushed installations. They're alleging Tesla's solar division had this ill-considered business model that just pushed them to install systems haphazardly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Walmart says in the lawsuit it believes the failures were the result of rushed installation because Teslas solar division adopted an ill-considered business model that required it to install solar panel systems haphazardly and as quickly as possible in order to turn a profit...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: To turn a profit, I guess?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: To turn a profit, I guess?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. And the contractors, uh, they weren't properly hired or trained, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. And the contractors, uh, they weren't properly hired or trained, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and the contractors and subcontractors who performed the original installation work had not been properly hired, trained, and supervised.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Man. You know, this brings me back to Tesla's whole solar journey. Like, wasn't this a big acquisition for them?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Man. You know, this brings me back to Tesla's whole solar journey. Like, wasn't this a big acquisition for them?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: It was! They bought SolarCity back in 2016 for, like, $2.6 billion. But honestly, since then, it's been pretty rough.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It was! They bought SolarCity back in twenty sixteen for, like, two point six billion dollars. But honestly, since then, it's been pretty rough.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla got into the solar business after it acquired SolarCity in 2016 for $2.6 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Rough how? I thought it was supposed to be the future.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Rough how? I thought it was supposed to be the future.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, delays, plunging sales... it's been quite a struggle for the residential solar side.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, delays, plunging sales... it's been quite a struggle for the residential solar side.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But production of its residential solar panels under Tesla has been mired with delays and plunging sales.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: So, what's Elon Musk saying about all this, or doing? I heard something about new pricing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what's Elon Musk saying about all this, or doing? I heard something about new pricing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah! Just this week, actually, he announced a revamped pricing plan. Trying to, um, boost the slowing business.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah! Just this week, actually, he announced a revamped pricing plan. Trying to, um, boost the slowing business.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Just this week, CEO Elon Musk announced a revamped pricing plan in an effort to boost the slowing business.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Is that the rental thing? [overlaps] Where you can rent solar panels?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Is that the rental thing? Where you can rent solar panels?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! You can now rent solar systems for, like, fifty bucks a month in some states, instead of buying them upfront. Trying to make it more accessible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! You can now rent solar systems for, like, fifty bucks a month in some states, instead of buying them upfront. Trying to make it more accessible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The new pricing model allows residents in six states to rent solar power systems starting at $50 a month ($65 a month in California) instead of buying them up front.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Smart move, maybe, to try and save it. But wow, from fires to new rental models, uh, it's never boring with Tesla, is it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Smart move, maybe, to try and save it. But wow, from fires to new rental models, uh, it's never boring with Tesla, is it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Never, Host A, never.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Never, Host A, never.
